intro: Crucifera pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leafed crucifer, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has pinnately compound leaves with five leaflets, giving it its common name. It is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
